loans.name: Lucero

texts.es:
Lucero e suna joven de 23 años de edad, es madre de un pequeño de 1 añito y al cual saca adelnate sola ya que el padre de su pequeña la abandono cuando su hijito solo era un recien nacido, es por ello que cada dia Lucero se levanta con muchas ganas de hacer las cosas bien para poder ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor calidd de vida y sobre todo darle mucho amor y cariño. Debido a sus pocos recursos economicos Lucero solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubeira gustado mucho poder estudiar gastronomia.

Con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro lucero logro inicar su negocio de venta de abarrotes al cual le dedica alrededor de 10 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es responsable y amable con los clientes; pero por sobre todas las cosas tiene mucha fe en Dios y por ello todo le va bien.

Lucero esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda qu ele han brindado ella podra comprar un andamio y tambien comprara mercaderia para su negocio como fideos, conservas, menestras, enter otros, de esta manera ella podra exhibir mejor sus productos y tener mayor variedad de ellos, lo que le permitira seguir luchando cada dia para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Darle una profesion a su hijo y tener un minimarket"
texts.en:
Lucero is 23 years old and has a one-year-old son. She provides for him by herself, because the father of her child abandoned her shortly after he was born. Lucero wakes up every day with the motivation to do everything well in order to give her son a better quality of life, and above all to give him plenty of love and care. 

Due to her limited financial resources, Lucero was only able to study until the fifth grade of secondary school, but she would have very much liked to study a culinary degree.

With plenty of effort and savings, Lucero managed to establish a business selling groceries. She works for about 10 hours and serves up to 15 customers daily. She believes that her business is going well because she is responsible and friendly to customers. Above all, she has faith in God and therefore everything is going well.

Lucero is very grateful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help, she will be able to buy shelves as well as merchandise for her business, such as noodles, canned food, and legumes, among others. She will then be able to better display her products and have a greater variety, which will allow her to continue fighting every day to make her greatest dream come true: that her son will become a professional and that she will have a minimarket someday.

loans.use: to buy shelves and merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer humilde ella vive en la ciudad de Ambato, ella tiene 21 años, María se define como una persona muy reservada, alegre, emprendedora muy trabajadora y feliz en los momentos que pasa con su familia, María tiene dos hijos una niña de 3 años y un niño de 4 años, María vive junto a su esposo y su hijos viven. María vio la manera de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y es por ello que se dedicó a la venta de ropa ya hace más de tres años.
El crédito solicitado a FODEMI se lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para luego vender en su local comercial, María va a comprar lo que es jeans, camisas, blusas, ternos deportivos para niños, damas y caballeros. María comenta que el trabajo es sacrificado pero tiene muchos réditos ya que se pasa en familia y cuando se pone muchas ganas las ganancias económicas son muy buenas.
El sueño que doña María tiene es el comprarse un local propio para trabajar junto a su esposo y con estas ganancias dar la educación a sus dos hijos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María’s a humble woman living in the city of Ambato; she’s 21-years-old and defines herself as a reserved, cheerful, enterprising, very hardworking person who is happy when spending time with her family.  María has two children, a 3-year-old girl and a 4-year-old boy.  María lives with her husband and children.  María decided to start selling clothes more than three years ago as a way to help her husband with household expenses.

She’s asking FODEMI for a loan to buy clothes to then resell in her commercial locale.  María will buy jeans, shirts, children’s, women’s and men’s sportswear.  She comments that the work is demanding but quite rewarding because she spends her time with her family and when she puts much effort into it the economic profits are very good.  Her dream is to buy a place of her own to work in with her husband and with profits from it to provide schooling for her children and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Rayito De Sol Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rayito de Sol está conformado por nueve mujeres responsables y trabajadoras que se esmeran siempre por sacar adelante a su familia, estas mujeres viven en una comunidad donde la gente además de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz también se dedica al comercio es un lugar pequeño y muy tranquilo. El nombre del grupo se eligió ya que cuando las integrantes formaron el grupo, la representante de entonces tenía un grupo musical de niños llamado "Rayito de Sol".
Doña Elena quien forma parte del grupo platica que tiene 40 años de edad es una mujer casada desde hace 20 años con el señor Israel, juntos han formado una familia con 2 niños que se encuentran estudiando, Doña Elena desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de vasos de licuadora y productos de jarcería inicio con su actividad cuando se caso con su esposo Israel, Doña Elena comento "Yo inicie con la ve venta de estos productos porque de alguna manera queria ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos del hogar para mis hijos sobretodo para que ellos pudieran tener una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educacion" A Doña Elena siempre le ha gustado mucho vender sus productos ya que cuando le va bien puede comprar alimentos, ropa, zapatos para sus hijos, solo que su unica dificultad es cuando las autoridades encargadas no las dejan salir del mercado para ofrecer sus productos y esto le afecta en sus ganancias, esto no la detiene en nada ya que siempre ha tenido la intencion de poder llegar a tener un puesto establecido en algun lugar y ya no tenga que caminar tanto, a Doña Elena le gustaria mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Asi como Doña Elena tiene su actividad tambien las otras integrantes del grupo tienen su actividad como Doña Elvia, Florentina compraran productos para su tienda de abarrotes, Doña Juana invertira en batas y mandiles, Eufemia, Carolina controles para TV Paulay Guadalupe invertiran en vasos de licuadora, y Doña Josefina en Chales y rebosos.
texts.en:
The “Rayito de Sol” (Little Ray of Sunshine) group is comprised of nine, responsible, hardworking women who strive always to move their families forward.  These women live in a community where people in addition to growing corn also work in commerce; it’s a small, very tranquil place.  The name of the group was chosen because when they joined together one of the members had a children’s musical group called “Rayito de Sol.”

Elena, 40, who is a member of this group, relates that she’s been married to Israel for 20 years; they have formed a family and have two children attending school.  Elena has been selling blender jars and cleaning supplies for 20 years having started her activity when she married her husband, Israel.  Elena commented: “I started selling these items because I wanted to somehow help my husband with household expenses, especially for my children, so they would have a better quality of life and a good education.”

Elena has always enjoyed selling her products because when she does well she’s able to buy food, clothes and shoes for her children.  The only difficulty is when the authorities in charge prevent them from going outside the market to sell their wares because this affects their profits.  This hasn’t stopped her though; her goal has always been to have an established stand somewhere in order not to have to walk so much.  Elena would like to improve her children’s quality of life.

The same as Elena, the other group members also have their activities.  Florentina will buy stock merchandise for her store, Juana will buy robes and aprons, Eufemia and Carolina will buy television controls, Paula and Guadalupe will buy blender jars and Josefina will buy shawls and wraps.

loans.use: to buy spoons, plates, blender jars, etc.

location.town: San Agustin San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Nupi Sintha Group

texts.en:
This is the Nupi Sintha group, which consists of nine members. They belong to a non-tribal community and live in a small village on the outskirts of the Imphal East district in Manipur state, which is in the northeastern part of India. This part of the state is famous for brewing local wine and the flavor can closely be associated with that of Tequila and Vodka.

Memcha is the profiled member pictured with her hand raised. She studied up to class VIII. Now she is 51 years old and is a mother to a daughter and two sons who are already in their late 30’s. All her children are school dropouts due to the poor conditions of the family.  Her husband is a farmer by profession and is a daily wage earner. In order to supplement the family income, she has been running a pickle store with a small budget to earn income. Due to insufficient capital, she can never upgrade her store with other products to sell other than a few eatables and self-made pickles.  

In 2010, with her first loan, she bought stocks to sell for profits. She used the loan to stock grocery items to sell such as onions, tomatoes, dal, cooking oil, fermented fish, sugar, milk and varieties of eatables. Her wish to expand her store business was fulfilled, for which she is ever grateful. With the sale of the store stocks, she collected larger profits that she used wisely. With her second loan too, she bought store stock to sell. With the saved profits, she renovated her store by making proper shelves to stack the items. Apart from the loan liability, she was able to save as much as INR 700 per month by way of local savings with 25 other members, where the total money collected monthly is utilized on a rotating basis.
  
Since her children are coming of age, she wishes to build and provide a good house for them. She also plans to purchase a paddy field for the family's sustainability, where she can keep her two sons engaged and busy with something useful. With the expansion of her store business, she let her daughter manage the store while she helped her two sons with their quarrying activities to increase their income.

She needs another loan to continue with her general store business. She will use the loan to stock fresh products to sell at her store. With steady improvement and with the loan, she is making progress towards expanding her store. Likewise, the rest of the group members too wish to do better with their respective income-generating activities.

loans.use: To buy fresh stock to sell at her store

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jose es un joven que vive en la calida ciudad de Chincha, la cual no solo se caracteriza por su clima caluroso sino tambien por ser la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimimo sus pobladores tiene un don especial para la preparacion de alimentos ya que lo hacen de manera deliciosa. Jose es muy trabajador y es por ello que desde hace 1 año tranaja como ayudante de mecanica en una pequeña empresa de mecanica de su ciudad, con el fruto de su trabajo el apoya a sus padres y tambien solventa sus estudios ya que el esta cursando la carrera de mecanica automotriz en un instituto de su ciudad; el cree que le va bien en su t5rabajo proque es responsable y sobre todo porque hace su trabajo con mucahs ganas.

Jose esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la aydua que le han brindado el podra comprar sus materiales de estudio como libros, folletos, herramientas, entre otros y de esta manera tener los implementos y materiales necesarios para poder estudiar, asi el seguira lucahdno para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Terminar su carrera y poder formar su propio Taller de mecanica".
texts.en:
Jose is a young man who lives in the warm city of Chincha, which is not only characterized by its hot climate but also by being the birthplace of great celebrities of Peruvian sport. Additionally, its inhabitants have a special talent for food preparation since they do so in a delicious manner. Jose is very hard-working and it is because of this that he has been working for a year as an assistant mechanic in a small garage in his city. With the fruit of his labor he supports his parents and also pays for his studies since he is pursuing a degree in automotive mechanics at an institute in his city. He believes that he does well in his work because he is responsible and above all because he works with great enthusiasm.

Jose is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help that they have provided him, he will be able to buy his study materials, like books, booklets, pamphlets, tools, among others, and thus have the implements and materials necessary to be able to study. Therefore, he will continue fighting to be able to make his greatest dream a reality: “Finish his degree and be able to open his own mechanic’s garage.”

loans.use: to pay school expenses (books, booklets, pamphlets, among others).

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba originaria de Teustepe, tiene la edad de 36 años, casada, es madre de  2 hijos entre la edades de 6 y 14 años respectivamente, actualmente están estudiando, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Inicio con capital propio, en el ámbito del comercio trabajando  desde muy  joven empezó vendiendo ropa usada con su prima de forma ambulante, luego se caso y decidió independizarse,  de esta manera ella busca como ganarse la vida saliendo a vender en las Comarcas mas cercanas, ya que  ella cuenta con clientes fijos que solo le va a entregar la ropa que le encargan, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien le ayuda económicamente en su negocio, sus expectativas es seguir invirtiendo en mas ropa nueva y usada, para obtener mejores ingresos.
Alba solicita el financiamiento para comprar una paca de ropa usada. Ya que ella estima que este préstamo le ayudaría a comprar mas ropa  solicitada por sus clientes que aun no tiene en existencia para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientela, sus planes futuro es poder pagarles sus estudios universitarios a sus hijos para que tengan un mejor nivel de vida, su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Alba, 36, is from Teustepe; she’s married and the mother of two children aged 6 and 14 respectively and currently attending school.  She’s a merchant.  She sells used clothes.  She started out in the commercial area with her own capital when still very young selling used clothes with her cousin from place to place.  Then she got married and decided to work independently seeking a way to earn a living going to various nearby districts to sell; she has regular customers to whom she delivers clothes they've ordered from her.  She has her husband’s economic support in her business.  Her expectation is to continue investing in more used and new clothes to earn higher income.

Alba is requesting financing to buy a bale of used clothes because she feels that this loan will help her buy more clothes that are requested by her customers but she does not have in stock to meet their needs.  Her future plan is to be able to pay for her children’s university studies so they will have a better standard of living.  Her short-term goal is to make improvements to her home’s infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Aroma Group

texts.es: El grupo “Aroma” está conformado por 9  mujeres y un hombre todas son personas trabajadoras y responsables el nombre del grupo se eligió de esa manera ya que no se decidían por un nombre ellos querían el nombre de alguna flor o planta sin embargo entre bromas salió el nombre de aroma se le ocurrió a un hombre que ahora ya no se encuentra a en el grupo. Doña Magdalena es una integrante platica que tiene 52 años de edad esta casada con el señor Apolinar desde hace 34 años juntos formaron una familia con hijos pero ya todos son grandes y ya son independientes de dicha pareja. Doña Elena como de cariño la llaman platica que desde hace  8 años se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo solo que esta vez solo esta solicitando un crédito para comprar más ropa pero solo de bebe , platica que inicio su actividad porque uno de sus hijos se dedicaba a la venta de discos pero luego se cambio a la venta de ropa y fue como Doña Elena decidió  dedicarse a la venta de Ropa, vende solo los días lunes en una plaza en un municipio del Estado, está muy contenta y agradecida por el crédito que la institución le esta otorgado, porque gracias  a su crédito podrá comprar más ropa de bebe su puestecito lo podrá ampliar y sus ganancias crecerán, Doña Elena comento “Para mi es mejor tener gran variedad de ropa para poder ofrecerle a mis clientes y con gusto regresaran para poder comprarme mas ropa para su familia” Doña Elena todas las temporadas navideñas tiene dificultades con su puesto ya que en estas épocas las autoridades encargadas de repartir los puestos le dan preferencia a  los comerciantes que venden artículos navideños como series, arbolitos, esferas, etc. Y muchas veces tiene que quedarse sin su puesto, estas épocas, La meta de Doña Elena es llegar a tener un local donde pueda vender su ropa ya ya tendrá que estar pasando por lo de siempre. Los integrantes del grupo son Adela quien invertirá en maíz para vender tortillas y una bascula, Linares y Alejandra en pollos, Teresa en Cerdos, Lourdes y Adriana en borregos, Agripina en venta de mochilas, Laura y María Maura en pollos y Guajolotes.
texts.en:
The “Aroma” group is composed of nine women and one man; all are hardworking, responsible people.  The name of the group was chosen this way because they couldn't decide on a name.  They wanted the name of a flower or a plant; however in the midst of joking around the name “aroma” occurred to a man who is no longer a group member.

Magdalena is a group member.  She relates that she’s 52-years-old and married to Apolinar for the last 34 years.  They formed a family with children but they are all grown now and living independently from this couple.  Doña Elena, as she’s affectionately called, relates that she’s been selling all types of clothes for the last 8 years but on this occasion is asking for a loan to only buy clothes for babies.  She relates that she started her activity because one of her children sold records but then changed over to selling clothes and Doña Elena decided to also sell clothes.  She sells only on Mondays in one of the state’s municipalities.  She’s very happy and grateful for the loan that the institution is granting her because thanks to the loan she’ll be able to buy more baby clothes for her little stand and will be able to expand and her profits will grow.  Doña Elena commented: “For me it’s better to have a wide variety of clothes to offer my customers who then happily return to buy more clothes for their entire family from me.”  

During the Christmas season, Elena always has problems with her stand because during this season the authorities in charge of assigning the stands give preference to those merchants selling Christmas items like sets of lights, trees, tree decorations, etc. and often she’s left without a stand during this season.  Elena’s goal is to someday have a stand where she can sell her clothes and not have to be going through this time after time.

The group members are Adela who will buy corn to make tortillas and a scale, Linares and Alejandra who will buy chickens, Teresa will buy pigs, Lourdes and Adriana will buy sheep, Agripina will sell backpacks, Laura and María Maura will buy chickens and turkeys.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes.

location.town: Dolores Hidalgo, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Leonid

texts.ru: Леонид - предприниматель из города Дрогобыч. Вот уже много лет, как он ремонтирует обувь. У Леонида есть свой коиск и много клиетов, которые обращаются к нему за помощью, когда им нужно отремонтировать обувь. Недавно Леонид сделал ремонт в своем обувном киоске. Теперь он может работать в более комфортных условиях да и киоск приобрел более привлекательный вид. Леонид просит предоставить ему кредит на закупку материалов для ремонта обуви - кожи, подошв, нитей, пр.
texts.en: Leonid is a businessman from the city of Drogobych. He has been repairing shoes for many years. Leonid has a koisk and many clients, who initially come to him for help when they need to repair their shoes. Leonid recently renovated his shoe repair kiosk. Now he can work in a more comfortable situation, and the kiosk has a more appealing look. Leonid has requested a loan to buy material for shoe repair--leather, soles, thread, etc.

loans.use: to buy materials for repairing shoes.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru: Муроджон молодой и энергичный человек. Ему 26 лет. Он женат, но еще не имеет детей. Он с детства учился у мастера ремонта дома. Обычно он ходил к мастеру после занятий в школе. Он упорно трудился, в то время как другие дети играли после урока. Уже 5 лет как он работает самостоятельно и имеет 1 ученика. Его родители и его жена довольны его работой, но его доход последнее время не хватает для содержания семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Поэтому его жена тоже хочет работать и приносить выгоду для семьи. Она умелая портниха и шьёт красивые женские платья. В их городе потреб портнихам большой, так как из ближайших районов приезжают женщины для шитья их платья. Уже несколько месяцев, как она просит Муроджона купить ей швейную машинку, чтобы она могла организовать свой бизнес. Муроджон запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Этот займ поможет семье Муроджона получить дополнительный доход и таким образом улучшить условию проживания и создать хорошее условие для их будущих детей. Муроджон и его жена ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en: Murodjon is a young and energetic person. He is 26 years old, married, and has no children. Since he was a child he apprenticed with masters of home renovation. He usually went to his apprenticeship after school. He worked hard while the other children were playing after class. He has worked independently for five years, and now has a student of his own.  His parents and his wife are satisfied with his work, but his income not enough to support a family. So his wife also wants to work and bring in money for the family. She is able to tailor and sews beautiful dresses. In their town there is a great need for dressmakers.  Because of this, women from the surrounding areas come to their town to sew clothes. For several months, she has been asking Murodjon to buy her a sewing machine so that she can start a business. Murodjon is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine. This loan will help Murodjon's family by providing additional income and thus improve living conditions. It will also establish a good environment for their future children. Murodjon and his wife are waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for his wife

loans.name: Rafael Ángel

texts.es:
El Sr. Rafael se dedica a comercializar cal y sal en el norte de Nicaragua, negocio que tiene dieciséis años de tenerlo, con lo que ha podido salir adelante con su familia.
Antes de tener su plan de negocio era conductor y vendedor de cemento en diferentes ciudades de Nicaragua, sin embargo por iniciativa propia y ahorros personales logra establecer su negocio en donde genera ingresos para el sostén familiar.
En estos momentos necesita un financiamiento para hacer realidad su plan de inversión, adquiriendo cal y sal para atender la demanda de sus clientes, quienes en su mayoría son dueños de ferreterías, cafetaleros y ganaderos de la zona norte del país.
Su estado civil es casado, y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa para la administración de su negocio.
texts.en:
Rafael is a lime powder and salt merchant in north Nicaragua; the business has been in operation for 16 years and it has made it possible for him and his family to get ahead.

Before having his business plan he was a driver and sold cement in various cities in Nicaragua.  However, on his own initiative and with personal savings he managed to establish his business where he generates income to support his family.

He currently needs financing to make his investment plan a reality acquiring lime powder and salt to meet customer demand; most of his customers are hardware store owners, coffee growers and cattlemen in the northern part of the country.

He’s married and his wife helps him run the business.

loans.use: to buy lime powder and salt.

loans.name: Manuel Jaime

texts.en:
Manuel is a 45 years old and lives in Nazca, Peru with his three children and life partner. His children are 18, 16, and 10, and, with the exception of the youngest, have studied until the 5th grade. The youngest is still in primary school. Manuel studied in a local university and, while he was always interested in a career in metallurgic engineering, he chose a career in agriculture.

Manuel works six hours every day in his own business. He cultivates tuna, a South American fruit, to attract the cochineal insect, which is then used to make red dye for pigmenting cosmetics and paints. He also grows tomatoes. His business is successful because of his experience in the field. In addition to his own enterprises, Manuel works for a mining operation. 

He has requested a loan to cover the expenses of planting new crops and getting rid of insect infestation. This loan would enable him to have a good harvest of cochineal and continue his success with tomatoes. Manuel's greatest dream is to own his own ranch.

loans.use: to plant new crops and rid them of insect infestation.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es: La  Sra. Narcisa tiene 62 años, casad, tiene siete hijos mayores e independientes, La  Sra. Narcisa  se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, dulces, refrescos y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, La  Sra. Narcisa va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes para surtir su negocio como arroz, fideo, harina y azúcar por mayor para surtir su tienda  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La  Sra. Narcisa va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, ya que esta época es de mucha demanda,  su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela.
texts.en: Narcisa, 62, is married and has seven adult, independent children.  Narcisa sells a variety of basic staple items like groceries, candy, soft-drinks and a variety of other items in her neighborhood store.  This loan is her second sequence in the institution and Narcisa will use this loan to buy a variety of grocery items like rice, noodles, flour and sugar at wholesale to stock her store thus providing variety for her customers.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business.  Narcisa will use profits to continue buying products thus improving her income because this is a high-demand season.  Her wish for the business is to have a warehouse to provide better customer service.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Amelia Sabrina

texts.es:
Amelia Sabrina tiene 31 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene cinco hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Amelia Sabrina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul, además se dedica a la críanza de patos y cerdos. Las compras y las ventas las realiza en el cantón Ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos, urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque se podrá invertir en la agricultura y compra de los abonos.

El sueño es comprar maquinaria agrícola. En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Amelia Sabrina is 31 years old.  She is in a common-law marriage and has 5 children.  She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in the Los Rios province.

She is a member of the communal bank "Dulce Sentimiento," which meets in Recinto Caimito II in Puerto Pechiche parish, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo.  The members of this communal bank are farmers who work in short cycle agriculture, cultivating corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Amelia Sabrina is a farmer who cultivates corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  She also raises ducks and pigs.  She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas canton.  She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, supplies, urea, herbicides, fertilizers and brushkiller to maintain her crops in good condition.

This loan will help her a lot, because she will be able to invest in her farming business and to purchase fertilizers.

Amelia Sabrina's dream is to buy farming machinery.  In her spare time, she likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, urea, herbicides, fertilizers and brushkiller

loans.name: Jhosep

texts.es:
Jhosep, de 25 años es un joven padre de familia, trabajador e independiente. Vive en compañía de su esposa Sonia y su hija Irma, a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 2 años. 
Desde pequeño aprendió del campo a amar la tierra y vivir de ella, es por esa razón que todos los días desde muy temprano agradece a Dios por estar siempre con el y rendir la tierra, tiene 6 años de experiencia en el negocio, ahí aprendió a cuidar los sembríos su especialidad es el zapallo de buena calidad, pues el los nutre con fertilizantes orgánicos, naturales. En la actualidad tiene 4 hectáreas de sembrío y desea seguir sembrando más, pues espera de este año una buena temporada. “La agricultura es poco difícil, se tiene que esperar varios meses para tener ganancias, por esa razón comencé en el negocio de compra y venta de ganado en especial de toros de toda calidad y tamaño”, afirma. Ahora espera poder incrementar su ganadería, aumento la crianza de animales menores, ya que en la venta de animales obtiene ganancias diarias. Jhosep, invertirá el dinero en la compra de varias latas de semilla de zapallo, además de fertilizantes naturales para distribuir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Jhosep, 25, is a young, hardworking, independent father.  He lives in company of his wife, Sonia, and his daughter, Irma, who he cares for in the house he bought two years ago.

He learned to work in the fields and to love the land and to earn his living from it since he was a boy.  Because of this, he thanks God very early in the morning every day for always being by his side and for his fertile land.  He has six years’ experience in this business.  He learned to care for his crops there; his specialty is good quality pumpkins because he nourishes them with organic, natural fertilizers.

He currently has four hectares planted and wants to continue planting more because he’s expecting a good season this year.  “Agriculture is a bit difficult; one must wait several months to earn profits which is why I've gone into the business of buying and selling cattle, especially bulls of all qualities and sizes,” he affirms.  Now, he hopes to increase his cattle a bit and increase his small farm animal husbandry because he earns daily profits from his animal sales.  Jhosep will use the money to buy several cans of pumpkin seeds as well as natural fertilizer to spread among his crops.

loans.use: to buy pumpkin seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Marlaine

texts.en: Marlaine is 30 years old and married with 7 children. She has a small canteen stall where she bakes and sells pancakes, buns, scones, sandwiches and more in her community or at the market. Marlaine needs a loan to buy plastic bags, sugar, flour, yeast, dripping oil and a gas oven to help her with the business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008, and joined to gain access to financial services. Marlaine hopes to use her earnings to improve her family assets.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, bread, plastic bags, yeast, dripping oil, a gas oven, etc.

loans.name: Talu

texts.en: Talu is 65 years old and widowed with 6 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, and yams so that she can sell them in her community or at the market with her children's help. She has been doing this for 3 years. Talu needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, some bush knives, weed killer spray, etc.. She was a new member of SPBD in 2012. Talu will use the profits from her sales to improve her family standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, bush knives,weed killer,etc..

loans.name: Benso Group

texts.fr:
BENSO est un groupe de l’association Kelegna de Ouelessebougou. Il regroupe 4 femmes  mariées qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de céréales à l’image de ADA  qui est la deuxième de la gauche vers la droite de la photo et des articles divers. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou, dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe décident d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
ADA, très connue à Ouelessebougou, excelle dans la vente de céréales. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 sacs de maïs.  Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend à Ouelessebougou, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
BENSO is a group which is part of the Kelegna association of Ouelessebougou.  It is made up of four married women who know one another through family and neighborhood ties.  On average, they are 30 years old and have three children each.  They are involved in various activities: Ada, second from the left in the photo, buys and sells grains; other members of the group buy and sell other various goods.  They all live in large traditional families in Ouelessebougou, in the Cercle of Kati (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

The members of this group have been working in small retail business for several years, and their goods are in high demand. Eager to meet their customers' increasing needs, they have decided to join the loan program offered by Soro Yiriwaso.  This is their first solidarity loan.

Ada is a very popular seller in Ouelessebougou and she excels in the sale of grains.  She plans to use her loan to  buy five bags of maize.  She buys her goods from wholesalers, locally and in surrounding villages, and she resells her merchandise in Ouelessebougou, for cash or on credit, to a retail customer base consisting of men and women. 

She is expecting to make a monthly profit of 15,000 CFA francs, a sum which will allow her to repay her loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.ru:
Зайнура очень добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Она трудолюбивая и мотивированная женщина. Однако у этой прекрасной женщины трудная судьба. Ее муж бросил ее и дочь и женился на другой женщине. Он выгнал Зайнуру из дома. Зайнура вернулась к родителям с маленькой дочерью. Ее родители помогали ей во всем. Уже несколько лет она работает в средней школе своего кишлака учительницей. Зарплата у нее маленькая и не хватает для обеспечения дочери и себя. Родители тоже пенсионеры и не могут помочь дочери как прежде. Зайнура умеет ткать ковры. Это ремесло она научилась от своей бабушки. Зайнура планирует реализовать своё ремесло в бизнес и таким образом получать доход.
С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она получила много новых информаций для себя. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки сырья для изготовления ковров, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zaynura is a very kind and determined woman.  She is also very hardworking and motivated.  However, this beautiful woman has had a difficult life.  Her husband left her and her daughter and married another woman.  Zaynura was thrown out of her house and had to move back to her parents' with her young daughter.  Her parents helped her with everything.  

For a few years now, Zaynura has been working as a teacher at the local high school.  She receives a small salary, which is not enough to provide for herself and her daughter.  Moreover, her parents are retired, and they can no longer help their daughter as they used to do.  However, Zaynura knows how to weave carpets, a craft she learned from her grandmother.  Her plan is to turn this craft into a business, and to make some money out of it.

With this goal in mind, Zaynura has taken a course entitled "Achieving success", organized by the Association of Business Women, and she has earned a certificate.  This course has been very informative and Zaynura is now requesting a loan of 1,000 somoni to purchase the necessary supplies to weave carpets and start her new business.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy supplies for carpet making.

loans.name: Dina Elenita

texts.en:
Dina Elenita works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from E-loading and personal product sales. She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Dina Elenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita has been running a sari-sari store business for 12 years. She sells grocery items and some school supplies in their village. Estelita started the business with PHP 5,000 in capital. She realizes that her income from the business is good and she decided to make her business bigger.

Estelita is 50 years old and has one child. Her husband is a government employee. Estelita wishes that her sari-sari store business would become a mini grocery someday. She will manage the business well for continuous growth. Estelita plans to extend the products she sells to her costumers. She is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy beverages, bond paper, pens, and other school supplies to sell. Estelita strongly believe that she will attain her wish.

loans.use: to buy beverages, bond paper, pens, and other school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Neil Abel

texts.es:
Neil es un joven de 21 años de edad, el cual vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que s ecaracteriza por tener un clima muy calido y acogedor y tambien posee muchos atractivos turisticos muy visitados en toto el año por perosnas de todas partes del mundo. Neil es un joven muy trabajador, sobre todo porque en su vivienda tiene muchos problemas ya que su padre esta muy enfermo y debido a ello su mare no puede trabajar y junto a sus hermanos luchan cada dia para poder apoyar en todo lo que se pueda a su familia. Neil trabaja como mesero en una polleria de su ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al dia y el cree que esta saliendo adelante en su trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo honrado.

Neil esta muy agradecido con la ayuda que le brindan los prestatrios Kiva yq eu gracias a ello podra comprar medicinas para su padre ya que son muy costosas, asi podra brindarle el tratamiento que necesita su padre y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Mejorar la salud de su padre y Tener una carrera universitaria y ser el orgullo de sus padres y hermanos"
texts.en:
Neil is a young man of 21. He lives in the city of Nazca, characterized by having a very warm and welcoming atmosphere and also has many tourist attractions that are visited many times each year by people from around the world. 

Neil is a very hardworking young man, especially because he has many problems at home. Since his father is very ill and cannot work, together with his siblings, he fights each day to be able to support his family. Neil works as a waiter in a chicken restaurant in the city. He works around 9 hours a day and believes he is moving forward with his work because he is honest and responsible.

Neil is very grateful for the help given by the Kiva lenders. And thanks to you, he will be able to buy medicines for his father, as they are expensive. This will provide the medical treatment his father needs. He will continue to fight to realize his greatest dream: "To improve his father's health, to get a college degree, and to be the pride of his parents and siblings."

loans.use: to buy medicines.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a barquillos-making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from making ice cream. Helen is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy flour, oil, sugar and other ingredients for making barquillos (a type of cookie).

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, sugar and other ingredients

loans.name: Taualii

texts.en:
Tapualii is 24 years old and married with two children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, and yams so that she can sell them in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Tapualii needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, some bushknives, weedkiller spray and more tiapula (to grow taro).
 
She was a new member of SPBD last year in 2012 and joined to gain access to financial stability. Tapualii will use the profits from her sales to improve her family assets.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, shovel, bushknives, weedkiller spray, etc.

loans.name: Ruthina

texts.en:
Ruthina is 60 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ruthina is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Ruthina has been farming rice for six years and earns additional income from raising ducks.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice and boarding house rental. Amalia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en: Silia is 58 years old and is separated with 4 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas and yams to sell to her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Silia needs a loan to buy another wheelbarrow, shovel and rake as well as bush knives and weed killer spray. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Silia will use the profits from her sales to improve her family assets.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, shovel, rake, weedkiller spray and bush knives for use in her garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, shovel, rake, bushknives, weedkiller spray etc.

loans.name: Seruni Group

texts.en:
The "Seruni" group was newly formed about one year ago. This group was formed because all the women had small businesses and knew each other. They have a common goal to further grow their businesses and improve the welfare of their families. There are so many types of businesses from the "Seruni" group including a Bridal Salon, selling herbs, selling cell phone credit, selling snacks, selling clothes and pillows, selling noodles and farming ducks and chickens.

Siti, the leader of this group, has a Bridal Salon. Her husband works as a contractor, Siti has two children who are still in school. With this loan, she wants to buy equipment and bridal makeup. Currently, she rents equipment, but with this loan she won’t have to do so. So the price that she charges clients will decrease, making her business more competitive. Her dream is to start a Bridal Course at her salon. This loan from Kiva will help develop the businesses of this group. Siti is very grateful to the lenders of Kiva, who have helped all the members of the group, even though the lenders don’t even know the members personally.

loans.use: to buy equipment and bridal makeup for her salon

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela de 37 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia.
Adela es una mujer independiente, pues cuida de sus hijos, sola. Su principal esfuerzo se ven recompensado por el  cultivo de productos de primera necesidad como, maíz y papa. Los cuales siembra con mucha dedicación ya que ella constantemente limpia la maleza que crece entre los surcos. Por otro lado le molesta la s plagas que llegan a sus cultivos producto del frío del lugar. Cuenta además que gracias a la buena intervención de sus sembríos puede contrarrestar los problemas causados por estas peligrosas bacterias. Gracias a ello obtiene buenas ganancias en la cosecha de sus sembríos. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de sus alimentos para poder recibir un precio más justo a sus sembríos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete pagar puntual sus cuotas. Pues es una persona responsable y solidaria. Adela; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcir en sus sembríos de maíz que muy pronto cosechará.
texts.en:
Adela is a hard-working woman of 37. She lives with her children, whom she cares for in her own house. Adela is an independent woman, since she cares for her children alone. Her principal endeavor is rewarded by growing basic products such as corn and potatoes, which she plants with great care, and she constantly cleans out the weeds that grow between the furrows. On the other hand, what bothers her are the pests that arrive in her fields as a result of the cold location. She furthermore comments that thanks to the good management of her fields, she can counteract the problems caused by these dangerous bacteria. Thanks to this, she obtains good earnings with the harvest of her crops. Now she wants to improve the quality of their feeding to be able to receive a more equitable price for her crops. 

This is her fourth loan with MFP, where she feels that she has progressed and is happy, since she hopes to obtain the loan to continue with her goals. Furthermore, she promises to make her payments punctually, since she is a responsible and loyal person. Adela will invest the money she has applied for in the purchase of organic compost to scatter among her plantings of corn, which she will soon harvest.

loans.use: to buy organic compost

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
In addition to farming, Wilson engages in a retailing business selling drinks, breads and spices. He has been in the business for eight years. Wilson shares that his profits from the business almost always went for his children's education. He also shares that at present their living conditions don’t have any improvement because he always prioritizes his three children's needs in school in pursuing their education.

At all times, Wilson looks for the improvement of his business. His goal is to increase his earnings to continue supporting his three children's needs in pursuing their education. Wilson wishes for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy beverages, canned goods, eggs and soap. In the future, his children will finish their education and see his effort in carrying his family.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods, eggs and soap.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is a hardworking entrepreneur who for the past ten years has prepared and sold food in the Philippines. She also earns more through her catering services.

With the help of NWTF loans Flor has sustained her business through her own efforts. She is now applying for a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients for the food she sells. Her ambition is to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for the food she sells.

loans.name: Omara Del Socorro

texts.es:
Omara del Socorro de 27 años de edad, casada con 1 hijo de 1 ano de edad, del departamento de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona  central de país. Se caracteriza por ser sociable, trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar administracion de Empresa.
Gracias a su espíritu de Emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de  piñatas y productos para fiestas, desde hace 11 años que se dedica a dicha actividad. La rutina diaria de Omara es trabajar unas 12 horas al día en su puesto de trabajo, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto, ya que hasta la fecha ha sido su medio de ingresos y su familia.
Omara se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva que gracias a la ayuda que le brindan podrá invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de piñatas y artículos para fiestas. De esta manera podrá sostener el negocio e incrementar sus ingresos en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en:
Omara del Socorro is 27 years old and married with one son who is one year old.  She is from the department of Managua, a place that is located in the central part of the country.  She is characterized as being sociable, hardworking and eager for personal improvement.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, she was unable to study for a university degree but she would have liked to study business administration.

Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and her desire to get ahead she has as her economic activity the sale of piñatas and party products.  For 11 years she has made a living in this activity.  The daily routine of Omara is to work about 12 hours a day in her workplace, an activity that she carries out with great pleasure since to date it has been the means of income for her and her family.

Omara is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help that they provide her she will be able to invest in working capital and stock her business in the buying and selling of piñatas and party items.  In this way she will be able to sustain the business and increase her income in the not too distant future.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock her business of buying and selling piñatas and party items.

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like noodles, spices, eggs, soft drinks, etc. for her general store business.

Chanda has been in this business for nine years. Chanda earns more income from buying and selling bamboo.

Chanda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to buy farmland in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like noodles, spices, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
This is Estrella, 63, a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She and her children work hand in hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.   

Estrella operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sells it for a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of merchandise like women's wear, kid's wear and shirts to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Estrella hopes to expand her business and dreams that her grandchildren will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise like women's wear, kid's wear and shirts to sell

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is 55 years old, married and has nine children. Two of her children are in school.

Angelica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a tricycle transport service in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle transport.

Angelica has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the tricycle transport service for 30 years and earns additional income from her general store.

Angelica aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, who is 56 years old and a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Levi, a vendor, and is a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a direct-selling business. At this time, she and her husband are working hard to earn income for her everyday expenses.  

Nenita sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk and Marikina Shoe Exchange. The dealer pays for a customer’s order in cash and gives the customer one month to pay. The prices for dealers are lower than those in the catalogues, which customers pay. It’s the difference between the two that the dealers earn as income. 

Nenita’s regular customers are her neighbors and members of her local community. She earns a minimum 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every week. To help her continue operating of her business, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy additional supplies and merchandise needed for her business, such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, and undergarments. She expects to boost her income as she expands her business. 

Nenita hopes to expand her business and have a canteen. She also dreams of having her own house for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.*

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed for her business, such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, and undergarments.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a 40-year-old widow who has three children in school. She has been raising and selling pigs for the past six years. She also earns additional income working in her sari-sari, or general store.

Mila is applying for a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicine for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Elvira is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es:
Cindy, de 28 años, es una mujer buena y amable, es conviviente con Francisco de 32 años con quien tiene una pequeña hija llamada Mayte de tan solo 5 años de edad a quien desea brindarle una buena calidad de vida, ella vive en la casa propia que construyó con ayuda de su pareja, lo habita al lado de su familia y cada uno de sus miembros pone de su parte para seguir adelante. El trabajo de Cindy consiste en la venta de prendas de vestir exclusivas para niños, diariamente se dirige a la casa de sus amigos, vecinos y familiares para ofrecer todos los productos que tiene a la venta, no duda ningún momento en tocar la puerta de cada uno de ellos y convencerlos para que adquieran alguna prenda. Las prendas que ofrece son de diversas tallas y en variados modelos y colores. Por lo general vende a crédito aunque solo en algunos casos puede vender al contado. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 3 años, lo hace sola ya sea en su casa o en la de sus diferentes clientes. 
Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le permite tener tiempo para dedicarse a su familia, además que le permite aportar en la economía de su hogar, desea poder seguir trabajando y comenzar a ampliar su negocio vendiendo también calzados para niños, pero por el momento se concentra solo en mantenerse vigente en el mercado y más adelante expandir su pequeño negocio. Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, está satisfecha perteneciendo a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1800), comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería conformada por prendas de vestir y algunos zapatos en distintos modelos.
texts.en:
Cindy, who is 28, is a good, kind woman. She lives with Francisco, who is 32, with whom she has a little daughter named Mayte, who is only 5 years old and to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. She lives in her own house, which she built with the help of her partner. She lives there with her family, and each of its members takes a part in moving forward. 

Cindy's work consists of selling articles of clothing exclusively for children. Every day she goes to the homes of her friends, neighbors, and relatives to offer all the products that she has for sale. She doesn't hesitate for a moment to knock on each of their doors and convince them to acquire some item. The clothing that she offers is of different sizes and in various styles and colors. In general she sells on credit while only in some cases can she sell for cash. She has been doing this work for three years. She works alone, either in her home or in the homes of her various customers. She likes her work a lot, since it allows her to have time to spend with her family. Furthermore, it allows her to help with the household finances. She wants to continue working and begin to expand her business, also selling shoes for children, but for now she is concentrating only on keeping her place in the market and in the future expanding her little business. 

This is her third loan from MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, since this way she feels more certain of advancing in her work. Similarly, she promises once again to make her payments punctually, as she did with her past loans. She is satisfied with being a member of her communal bank, since all the members are very responsible and united. With the amount she has applied for (1800 PEN), she will buy a larger quantity of merchandise, consisting of articles of clothing and some shoes of different styles.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of merchandise, consisting of articles of clothing and some shoes in different styles.

loans.name: Ferolini

texts.en:
Ferolini is 27 years old and in a “de-facto” relationship with three children. She has a small garden where she grows bananas, yams and taro (a root vegetable native to southeast Asia) to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Ferolini needs a loan to buy another wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, some bush knives, a weed killer and more tiapula (the head of a taro root, used for replanting). She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development since 2011. She will use the profits from her sales to improve her family assets.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as a wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, some bush knives, and a weed-killer spray.

loans.name: Teofilo Maria

texts.es:
Teófilo es un hombre de 62 años y cursó la escuela primaria, tiene 2 hijos que son independientes pero que sin embargo les ayuda cuando requieren su apoyo. Vive solo y aunque a veces esto le cause mucha tristeza y preocupación por su futuro continua trabajando duro para conseguir el sustento diario. Vive en la Parroquia de Río Verde de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Es por esto que la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas.
Teófilo estableció un taller de enderezada y pintura de autos, gracias a la experiencia y conocimientos que su compadre y amigo le impartió desde hace 40 años. Trabaja de 8 a 10 horas en su taller y a través de los años ha logrado mejorar su negocio y obtener fidelidad y recomendaciones por parte de sus clientes. Alrededor de su taller existen otros que prestan los mismos servicios con los cuales es difícil competir en precios porque Teófilo ha tenido varios impedimentos para conseguir préstamos que le permitan mejorar la variedad de los productos que ofrece, pero cuando recurrió a Fundación Alternativa, todo cambió pues gracias a la intervención de Kiva, allí le facilitaron un préstamo con la agilidad y confianza que siempre esperó y el cual lo utilizará solo en compra de materia prima y productos al por mayor para obtener mayor descuento y así ofrecer precios competitivos a sus clientes. Las ganancias que obtenga de esta inversión los utilizará en parte para crear un fondo de ahorro para sustentar su vejez, pues por varios problemas de salud que le han molestado en los últimos años, Teófilo ha reflexionado que él no estará siempre habilitado para realizar el trabajo que tiene.
texts.en:
Teófilo is a 62 year old man who completed elementary school.  He has two adult children on their own, but the help him when he needs it.  He lives alone, although this causes him some sadness and concern about his future, he continues to work hard to gain his daily sustenance.  He lives in the Rio Verde Parish of Santo Domingo, the provincial capital of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, an Ecuadorian province that has had large growth in recent years.  Its capital is a city where the most attractive and appealing things are the delicious fruits and the food from this place.  It also has considerable business and has become a commercial trading port between the country’s mountains and coasts.  It also includes various tourist attractions that, along with its warm weather, are very well known by local and foreign tourists.  This is the reason that most of its residents have started some type of merchant or service business for tourists.

Teófilo set up an auto body and paint shop, thanks to his experience and knowledge his friend passed onto him 40 years ago.  He works 8 to 10 hours in his shop and has managed to improve his business and obtain loyalty and recommendations from his customers.  Others around his shop provide the same types of services so it’s difficult to compete on price because Teófilo has had some trouble getting loans that allow him to expand the variety of products that he offers.  Everything changed when he approached Fundación Alternativa.  Thanks to Kiva’s help he was able to get a loan quickly and he will use the money to buy supplies and products in quantity to get the best discounts so he can pass the savings on to his customers.  He will use earnings he gets from this investment to create a retirement fund.  He’s has various health problems these past few years.  Teófilo has stated that he will not always be able to work.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 39 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the store for 18 years and also earns income from buying and selling fish.

Angelita has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy stock, such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, and spices. 

Angelita has borrowed and paid three previous loans. She aspires to saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell in her general store, such as canned goods, noodles, eggs and spices.

loans.name: Doli

texts.es:
Doli, de 52 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy trabajadora, es conviviente con Aurelio de 61 años con quien tiene seis hijos a quienes brindó educación y crió con buenos modales y valores, vive en su casa propia que pudo construir hace 9 años con el apoyo de su cónyuge, ahí vive actualmente solo con una hija y 3 nietos, junto a ella realiza su mejor esfuerzo para seguir adelante por el bien de sus nietos y para que ella más adelante pueda llevar una vejez tranquila.
La función laboral que cumple Doli, consiste en la venta de ropa, sandalias, zapatillas y otros accesorios de uso cotidiano. Toda su mercadería es enviada en grandes paquetes por su hija desde otra ciudad, cuando recibe su encargo selecciona los artículos que luego pondrá a la venta. Diariamente sale en busca de sus clientes por las calles de la ciudad, lleva consigo toda su mercadería para ofrecerlas de casa en casa, su modalidad de trabajo es al contado o al crédito y la cobranza lo realiza en forma diaria, semanal o quincenal. Por otra parte, cuando no consigue vender todo en la ciudad, viaja a los centros poblados que se encuentran cerca de la ribera de los ríos, ahí consigue vender todo y regresa a casa muy contenta después de aproximadamente 10 días de haber salido de la ciudad. Empezó con este oficio hace 2 años y algunas veces recibe el apoyo de su hijo quien tiene un vehículo y le ayuda en el traslado de su mercadería. Se siente muy satisfecha por lo bien que le va en ésta nueva etapa.
Le gusta mucho tener este trabajo porque le permite disponer mucho de su tiempo durante las horas que no está trabajando, ya que puede realizar las labores de su hogar con mucha comodidad, además a aprendido a ganarse el respeto y la confianza de los clientes en base a su buen trato y su gran sonrisa, tiene buenas ventas y como resultado de ello obtiene buenas ganancias, ahora espera seguir creciendo y más adelante  conseguir un puesto de ventas para continuar con su trabajo. Este es el crédito número 10 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su financiamiento para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometida una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
El monto solicitado (S/. 2000), lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería conformada por ropa, zapatillas y sandalias para continuar vendiendo.
texts.en:
Doli, who is 52, is a good, kind, and very hard-working woman. She lives with Aurelio, who is 61, and with whom she has six children, to whom she offered education and raised with good manners and values. She lives in her own house, which she was able to construct 9 years ago with the help of her partner. Now she lives there with only one daughter and three grandchildren. She makes her greatest effort to advance for the good of her grandchildren and so that she can have a tranquil old age in the future.

Doli's work consists of selling clothing, sandals, sneakers, and other accessories for daily use. All her merchandise is sent by her daughter in big packages from another city. When she receives her order, she selects the articles that she will sell. Every day she goes out through the streets of the city seeking customers. She takes all her merchandise with her to offer it from house to house. Her sales method is cash or credit, and she collects payments daily, weekly, or every two weeks. On the other hand, when she doesn't manage to sell everything in the city, she travels to the population centers near the shores of the river. There she manages to sell everything and return to her house very happy, approximately 10 days after having left the city. She began this work two years ago, and sometimes she gets help from her son, who has a vehicle and helps her transport her merchandise. She feels very satisfied for the good that she is doing at this new stage. 

She is happy to have this work because it gives her a lot of time during the hours when she is not working, since she can do her housework with great ease. In addition, she has learned to earn the respect and confidence of her customers, based on her good treatment [of them] and her great smile. She has good sales, and as a result of this she obtains good earnings. Now she hopes to continue growing and in the future acquire a sales stand to continue with her work. This is her tenth loan from MFP, for which she is grateful to those who make possible her financing to continue with her goals. On the other hand, she is very committed once again to making her payments punctually, as she did for her previous loans. She is very happy to belong to her communal bank, since all its members are very good, kind, and united. She will invest the amount she has applied for (2000 PEN) in the purchase of merchandise consisting of clothing, sneakers, and sandals to continue selling.

loans.use: to buy clothing, sneakers, and sandals to continue selling.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods. Gina is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of spices to sell in her business buying and selling spices.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of spices to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 43, resident of Batasan, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Roger, a security personnel, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Susan operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 24,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Susan hopes to expand her business and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Erdenechimeg is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband renders taxi service to local people using his own automobile. Before rendering taxi service, he was doing construction maintenance work in the summertime. Since 2010, she has been working as a neonatologist at maternity house. Two years ago, the family purchased a plot of land, and recently they have begun to build a house. But due to lack of finance the interior decoration work remains, so she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase the necessary construction materials. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable place, and the completely insulated house will enable them to burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Lene

texts.en:
Lene is 57 years old and widowed with five children.

Lene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like soft drinks, soap, sugar, and coffee, etc.

Lene has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lene aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert wants to exceed his profit for his four children. For this reason, he is now asking for a loan amount of PHP 20,000 for additional working capital in his farming business. It would be used to buy seeds to plant, fertilizers, and pesticides. He hopes that his crops will not be destroyed by any devastating insect or typhoon so that he can easily attain his aspiration. His wish is that the income can be used for his family's future as well as saved for continuing his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lucy works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lucy is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La Sra. Manuela es una persona de carácter muy amigable, ella se define como una mujer, luchadora, humilde, alegre y muy trabajadora,  Manuela  vive en la ciudad de Tulcán, provincia del Carchi al norte del Ecuador, Ella es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 11 años a quien ama y lucha  día a día por sacarle a delante, Manuela inculca valores éticos y religiosos a su hijo, son estas cualidades que hacen de manuela una mujer digna de admiración.
Manuela solicita a FODEMI un crédito que será invertido en la compra de cuadernos, libros, útiles escolares, útiles de oficina y papel en diferentes tamaños para utilizar en la copiadora que tiene dentro de su papelería, ya que su negocio está creciendo muy rápido y necesita más inversión para lograr cubrir la demanda existente de clientes.
El sueño que doña Manuela tiene es seguir trabajando en su papelería y copiadora por que le esta yendo bien y sabe que si sigue trabajando e invirtiendo mejor su dinero, podrá dar a su hijo una buena educación y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuela is a very friendly person, and she defines herself as fighter, modest, cheerful and hardworking. Manuela lives in the city of Tulcán, in the Charchi province in the north of Ecuador. She is a single mother and has a son who is 11 years old. She loves him and fights every day to get ahead. Manuela instills ethical and religious values to her son.
