Milka used her previous loan amount to purchase rice, sugar and maize meal for use in her restaurant. It was profitable and she has been paying back the loan well and in good time.

This being her second loan term, she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking flour for use in her restaurant business. She anticipates making more income in her business and using it to educate her children as well as expand her business.

Milka hopes to open a big hotel, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat for use in her restaurant.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is 52 years old and married to Lauriano, a farmer. For five years, she has operated a "sari sari store" (the common name for a variety store) in her village, where she sells canned goods, noodles, sugar, cooking oil and spices. Leonora earns 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from her business each week. This income is put back into the operation of her store so it will be maintained and eventually grow to meet her family's needs. She is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, noodles, sugar, candies, crackers, and soft drinks to sell and to attract more customers to her store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, sugar, candies, crackers and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
This is Karen, 30, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Stephen, a driver and is a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Karen operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Karen hopes to expand her business and dreams of becoming rich. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials from collectors.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 47 years old, a married mother of four children between the ages of 20 and 27 years. She is from Voi, a town located in the coastal part of the country. Elizabeth is a responsible, hardworking woman with a desire for self improvement. Ever since she was young she has struggled in life. Due to a lack of economic resources she was never able to complete her dreams of obtaining a college education. This has led her to fight day after day to ensure that her children have the necessary education to complete a college education. 

Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit she has her own source of income. She sells retail merchandise which consists of children's clothing, and clothing for adults, such as pants, shirts, dresses, shorts, skirts, undergarments, and linens. Her goal for this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business by purchasing new merchandise and satisfying the demands of her customers. In this way, in the near future, she will increase her income. Elizabeth is grateful for the assistance that Kiva donors provide to people of lesser means, and to impoverished countries such as Kenya, in opening up opportunities for dignified work.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing, and clothing for adults, such as pants, shirts, dresses, shorts, skirts and undergarments.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo is a 38-year-old married man and a father of four young children. He is from Ubay, Bohol. He is a fisherman and has been engaged in the fishing business for more than ten years now. This is the source of their income. 

Romulo is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks and buckets for storage. With this, he will be able to enhance his daily catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Romulo hopes to make his fishing business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks and buckets for storage.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is aged fifty-nine. He is a farmer in Kitale county in Kenya where he lives with his wife and four children who are all schooling. He has been in farming for the past ten years, producing eggs, milk and maize which he sells at the local market in his area.

He is requesting a 30,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. He will sell the products and earn extra money that will help him boost his family's livelihood and he will use some of the money to pay school fees for his children. He aspires to be the leading supplier of milk and eggs in his local area in the next five years.

Pests and diseases are his major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Claudia Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Claudia habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo e hijos, su esposa labora en una empresa privada y ella es comerciante, su mayor sueño es terminar su casa para mejorar de condiocnes. Su dificultad en la actualidad es que no puede reunir el dinero de una sala vez para comprar los materiales que necesita, ella ya tiene parte del mateial, con este nuevo credito comprar el restante: Cemento, Arena y Piedrin. Agradece el apyo brindado a Afodenic y Fondos Kiva.
texts.en:
Claudia lives in the Ticuantepe municipality with her husband and children.  Her husband works for a private company, and she is a merchant.

Her biggest dream is to finish her house in order to improve their living conditions.  The difficulty she now has is that she is not able to get the money together all at once in order to pay for the materials she needs.  She now has part of the materials.  With the new loan she will buy the rest.  She will buy cement, sand, and gravel.  

She is grateful for the support given by Afodenic and the Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.ru:
Александра с мужем и тремя взрослыми сыновьями живет в Каменке. Они все вместе занимаются выращиванием овощей на собственном земельном участке вот уже 12 лет. Бизнес приносит хороший доход, получается понемногу развиваться и делать отопление в теплицах для рассады. Муж Александры в прошлом году перенес инсульт. Сейчас особо работать в теплицах не может, поэтому в основном Александре помогают сыновья. 
Александре понадобились сумма в 24 000 гривен для покупки семян, удобрений и угля, а также для того, чтобы доделать отопление в теплицах. Со временем хотелось бы доделать качественное отопление в теплице для рассады, чтобы выращивать рассаду самим, а не закупать ее.
texts.en:
Alexandra, her husband, and their three grown sons live in Kamenka. Together, they have been cultivating vegetables on their plot of land for the past 12 years. The business brings a good income, and the family has been able to expand it over time, for example by gradually installing a heating system in the greenhouse for seedlings. Last year, Alexandra's husband suffered a stroke. Presently, he is not quite able to work in the greenhouses, and so Alexandra's sons are her main source of help.

Alexandra needs 24,000 hryvnia in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and coal, and also to complete the greenhouse heating system. In time, the family would like to have a quality heating system in the seedling greenhouse, in order to be able to grow the seedlings themselves instead of buying them.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and coal, and to finish constructing a greenhouse heating system

loans.name: Francisco Agustin

texts.es:
Francisco Agustín tiene 29 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.
Francisco Agustín se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón ventanas. 

Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, urea, mata monte, ranger, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque se podrá comprar los insumos y semillas sin ningún problema.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes el mal clima y las plagas. El sueño es comprar más terreno.
En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el futbol.
texts.en:
Francisco Agustín is 29 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. 

The Dulce Sentimiento communal bank is located in the Caimito II neighborhood in the Puerto Pechiche parish in the Pueblo Viejo canton. This communal bank is comprised of farmers who grow short-cycle crops such as corn, rice, and pigeon peas. 

Francisco grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. His makes his purchases and sales in the Ventanas canton. 

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, urea, herbicides, fertilizers, and weed killer so that he can keep his crops in good condition. This loan will be of great help because he will be able to buy supplies and seeds without any problem. 

The challenges he must face on a frequent basis are bad weather and pest infestations. His dream is to buy more land.

In his free time Francisco enjoys playing sports, especially soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, herbicides, fertilizers, and weed killer.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is in the livestock business. He has raised pigs for almost 30 years. He learned the business from his parents when he was a teenager until he got married. Reynaldo is now 46 years old and has three school-aged children.

Reynaldo desire to continue operating his business until his children finish their college education. Reynaldo is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy feed and vaccines for the maintenance of his hogs. He hopes to operate his business as long as he can manage it and see his children in professional careers someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge, de 27 años de edad, es un hombre que siempre le gustó hacerle frente a las circunstancias que se le presentan, es así como pudo salir adelante junto a Susan, quien es su conviviente y madre de su único hijo de 2 años de edad, juntos viven en una casa propia en donde hasta ahora el sigue esforzándose mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Jorge, trabaja en la compra y venta de madera, de manera constante se dirige hacia diversos pueblos ribereños en busca de obtener la madera necesaria para cumplir su trabajo, todo lo que obtiene lo vende en aserraderos de la ciudad o a personas particulares que requieren de este producto. Cuando no tiene oportunidad de viajar hacia la ribera de los ríos, trabaja en la ciudad comprando directamente en los aserraderos ubicados en los alrededores de la urbe. Trabaja con ayuda de su suegra quien le brinda el servicio de transporte fluvial. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 8 años y todo le esta marchando de maravilla. Agradece que las cosas le están yendo muy bien ya que tiene buenos clientes que a diario lo buscan por la calidad de madera que ofrece, espera seguir trabajando de esta manera y más adelante establecer un pequeño aserradero. Este es el crédito número 2  con MFP, está muy contento al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le brinde la garantía para continuar trabajando con mucha tranquilidad, él por su parte se compromete a seguir siendo puntual en el pago de sus cuotas así como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo, asimismo se siente cómodo perteneciendo a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 800 soles, comprará madera, asimismo en víveres y combustible que necesita para viajar hacia los pueblos ribereños.
texts.en:
Twenty-seven year old Jorge is someone who takes on whatever circumstances that are presented to him and that is how he, with his partner, has moved ahead in life.  He lives with his partner, Susan, and their only son (who is two years old) in their own house.  Here Jorge puts in a lot of effort to provide his family with a better quality of life.  

Jorge buys and sells wood and is constantly going to various riverside towns in order to find the wood necessary for his job.  Everything he finds he sells in the city’s sawmills or to private customers that need it.  When he does not have the time to travel along the river, he works in the city, buying directly from the sawmills located in the outskirts of town.  He works with the help of his mother-in-law who provides him with transport on the river.  Jorge has had this business for nearly eight years now and everything is going really well for him.  He is grateful that things are going so well and he has good customers that every day come looking for the excellent quality wood that he is offering.  He hopes to continue with this work and in the future would like to have his own sawmill.  This is his second loan with MFP and he is very happy to know that he has financial support that lets him continue to work in peace.  For his part, Jorge promises to continue to make his repayments on time, as he did with previous loans.  At the same time he feels comfortable with the communal bank because all its members are very responsible and supportive. 

With the loan of 800 Nuevo Soles that Jorge has applied for he will buy wood and also supplies and fuel, which he needs to travel to the riverside towns.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 53-year-old father of five children who runs a hotel business in Nakuru town. He is married to Penina. He has been in the business for three years now and it has been profitable.

This will be his second loan term. He plans to use the money to buy more stocks of foodstuffs such as corn flour, wheat flour and cooking fat to use in his business. He anticipates making more income, which he will use to further increase his food stocks. 

He hopes to expand his business by opening a a big hotel in Nakuru town to make more income and provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Consolatah

texts.en: The desire to have a dignified life is one of Consolatah's dreams, and she works very hard to ensure that she reaches success. She has been selling fish and she has gained much experience. She is thankful for the support she received from Kiva lenders which helped her to restock her business. Today, she is asking for another loan to invest in her existing fish business so that she can offer more fish to her increasing customers.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, age 40, is a farmer in Kitale, Kenya, where she lives with her husband and four children who are all in school. She has been in farming for the past four years. She produces milk and maize, which she sells at the local market in her area.

Christine is requesting a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She will sell the milk and use the money to pay the school fees for her children as well as boost her livelihood. She aspires to have two more dairy cows in the next five years.

Pests and diseases are her major challenges in farming.

She is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva for giving her the loan.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Delfin

texts.en:
Delfin is a 49-year-old married man and a father of seven children. He is from Ubay, Bohol. He has been engaged in a motorcycle transport business for more than 10 years now. 

Delfin is asking for a loan to buy fuel and spare parts for his motorcycle. The loan will also be used to finance his fishing business. 

Delfin hopes that through this loan, he will be able to improve his livelihood and support the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of his  children.

loans.use: to buy fuel and spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 57 years old and married with 3 children.

Ofelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 28500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more biscuits, canned goods, eggs, and other items to sell. 

Ofelia has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running this general store for 31 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Ofelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more biscuits, canned goods, eggs, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Being a responsible father, Noel aims to improve his family's living status, educate his children and give his family a better life. He is 48 years old and has two school-age children. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Noel plans to strengthen his small eatery to generate sufficient income to satisfy his family's needs and continue sending his children to school. However, he has inadequate capital. So he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fresh meat, fish, vegetables and spices to be cooked and sold in his eatery. 

Despite the problems and difficulties he has encountered in life, Noel has the determination to improve his business. He says that this financial assistance will be a great help to him in accomplishing his goal of growing his business.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat, fish, vegetables and spices needed for his eatery.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah, who is 30 years old, is from Nakuru. She is married with two children, ages 12 and 10.

Deborah has a retail business that she has been running for the past six years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy a secondhand motorcycle, which she will use to transport her goods.

She hopes to see her business expand in the near future so she can send her children to good schools.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, 46, is a businesswoman. She is married to Stephen, a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been a tailor for the past ten years with a monthly income of 20,500 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her sixth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Agnes will use the loan to purchase cloth and textile materials. 

She will also buy a sewing machine. With the anticipated profit from this business, she will educate her children. She hopes and dreams to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, sewing thread, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is 20 years old. She lives with her two children in the village of Dingading. She is a lively and innovative woman. She has worked throughout her life to give her children a good quality of life. She opened a store based in her home and has offered a variety of basic needs for two years. She works hard for her business. To make it possible, she is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHPto buy noodles, eggs, canned goods, beans, sugar, salt, detergent and other items that are attractive to her customers. With this loan, she hopes to enhance the quality of life for her family, which is the most important thing to her.

loans.use: to buy noodles, eggs, canned goods, beans, sugar, salt, detergent and other items to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, 43, is from Nyahururu and is married with three children who are between 14 and 18 years old.

Lucy has a poultry business that she has been running for the past eight years and has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy more chicks to add to her stock.

She hopes to own a rental house in the near future.

loans.use: to buy chicks to add to her stock.

loans.name: Felly Mae

texts.en:
Felly Mae is 26 years old and married with four children.

Felly Mae is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Felly Mae requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Felly Mae has been raising livestock for nine years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her livestock.

loans.name: Aong

texts.en:
Aong is 57 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $3 each day. 

Due to lack of funds, Aong is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a store in the market for her child to sell clothes. By doing so, her child would be able to make more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and help her youngest child earn bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a store in the market for her child to sell clothes.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Teresita has been in this business for four years. Teresita earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Ame Grace

texts.en:
Ame Grace is from the village of Dingading. She is 24 years old, and is married with one child. To generate income, Ame Grace is engaged in a direct-selling business. She offers lotions, cologne and perfume to her local community. 

She wants to have more products to offer and sell to her customers, that is why she is asking for a loan of the amount of PHP 30,000 to buy lipstick, shoes, lotion, deodorant and cologne to sell. Ame Grace believes that through patience and hard work her family will survive poverty.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, shoes, lotion, deodorant and cologne to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 62 years old and a widow with seven children. With four children in school, Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of eggs, canned goods, snack foods, noodles, etc to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for six years.

In the future Vilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of eggs, canned goods, snack foods and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Lenlailom Group

texts.en:
Lenlailom is a 9-member group of hard-working Tribal women in India. They live in a small village in the state of Manipur, one of the Seven North Eastern States, popularly known as the Seven Sisters. There is bus service from the main city, Imphal, and it takes about 3 hours' drive with a joyful bumpy ride.

Nempha is the profiled member, pictured with raised hand. She is 39 years old and is a mother to a son and a daughter who are in their teens. Other than farming and activities that result in daily wages, her husband does not have other means to earn income for the family. She grows vegetables in her homestead garden to maintain the family.

In 2010 with her first loan she started a small grocery shop by her house for the family's main income. She sells potatoes, sugar, 'dal' (lentils), chillis, salt, cooking oil, hair oil, toothbrushes, spices and 'pulses'. With the sale proceeds she repaid her loan liability. She could not save much because most of the income was used for the children's education. With good faith, to stock her store afresh she was able to negotiate with the wholesaler from the town for the supply in partial payments. In this way she has been running her store and earning income for the family. Through her business now she is in a position to save INR 200 daily after meeting the family requirements. 

Nempha needs another loan and this will be her second loan. She will use the loan to increase her store inventory that she will sell for a profit. She decided to expand to a department store for larger profit opportunities. She wants to introduce cosmetic items and beauty accessories.
 
The group members, too, like herself have been working hard and making steady improvement with their respective income-generating activities.

loans.use: To increase her store inventory and expand as a department store with cosmetics and beauty accessories.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
The desire to get ahead is enormous for Hadija, who works hard to provide for her family. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the last several years, she has raised chicks and chickens to subsequently sell. 

Despite the fact that crime is a very grave problem where she lives, she hopes to get ahead by working hard and ignoring the bad influences that surround her.

In an effort to take advantage of this new year season when the sale of guinea hens and chickens increases, Hadija is asking Yehu for a loan to buy larger numbers of chicks as well as chicken feed. This will enable her to fatten them up so they can be sold at a fair price. At the same time, she wants to expand her chicken house to provide more space to accommodate more chickens. 

Hadija very much wants to improve her life and have a better future. She would like to set an example for her neighbors, showing them that a better life -- away from delinquency -- is possible.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed, and expand her poultry house.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 31 years old, married, and has two children. He used his previous loan to buy maize flour, sugar and salt. His business did well and he successfully repaid his loan. He owns a general shop and has been in business for the past five years. He is very hard-working. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has learnt how to save his money for future purposes. 

Someday he hopes to own a wholesale shop. He requests a loan of 74,013.75 KES to buy maize flour, sugar, salt, wheat flour and fish.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar and salt, wheat flour and fish

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is a 53-year-old married man and a father of eight children from Bohol, Philippines. He has been a fisherman and a fish vendor for more than 30 years now. This is the source of his income.

Felipe is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell and to pay the school fees of his children. With this, he will be able to enhance his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Felipe hopes to make his fishing business a success and save money for the schooling of his children. Other revenue generated from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and to pay the school fees of his children.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing materials like bamboo, wood, a fishing net, etc. for her fishing business.

Shiela has been in this business for three years. Shiela earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

Shiela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials like bamboo, wood and a fishing net.

loans.name: Cecily

texts.en:
Cecile is 39 years old, married and has four children. She sells clothes and has been in business for four years. She also raises rabbits to earn a living. 

She describes her business as being very busy. She is very hard working, and thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money.

She hopes to be a successful business lady, and to open a boutique. 

She requires a loan of 20,857.50 KES to buy two bales of clothes.

loans.use: to buy two bales of used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 30 years old and married. She has four children. She earns a living by selling used clothes. She also relies on her husband's salary. She is hardworking, trustworthy and honest. Faulu Kenya has enabled her to expand her business.

She hopes to be a successful businesswoman and open a boutique. She requests a loan of 53,156.25 KES to buy bales of clothes.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes.

loans.name: Johaira

texts.en:
Johaira has been engaged in the footwear business for ten years. She is married and is a business-minded person.

Johaira would like to have continuous improvement of her business. That's the reason she is asking for a loan of PHP 35,000, which will be used to buy stocks of different kinds of shoes and sandals for sale.

She knows that through her requested loan amount she can earn greater profits, enabling her to get ahead in life and save some for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of shoes and sandals for sale.

loans.name: Blessing Group-Ii

texts.en:
Season’s greetings are coming to you from your borrowers in Koidu City, in eastern Sierra Leone. Members of the "Blessing II" group are very pleased to inform you that the previous loan they received from you has been very helpful in boosting their respective businesses. Each member of the group experienced vast improvements in their business. 

Group leader Bintu, for example, has been able to build a six bedroom house out of the profit she makes from her business. She also pays school fees for her children out of the little profit she makes on a daily basis.

Having finished repaying that loan successfully, group members are again requesting a new loan, this time for 800,000 Leones for each. With the help of this new loan, their businesses will further improve both in size and quality. 

The group leader, Bintu, will again use her share of the loan to buy cooking ingredients like rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), tomatoes, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, etc. in order to produce a larger quantity of cooked rice and sauce for sale.

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Edmond, in the white shirt)

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients in bulk in order to produce more food for sale.

loans.name: Riva

texts.en:
Having the passion for entrepreneurship, Riva is asking for a new loan in the amount of KES 100,000 to expand his fish-selling business. 

He plans to buy a deep freezer and more stock of fish. He is a determined man with a focus on his family. 

Riva thanks Kiva lenders for the support that they have given him. He cannot hide his joy for for this support that has enabled him to improve his living standards. He says that he will continue to ask for more Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer and more stock of fish.

loans.name: Jonathan Nestor

texts.es:
Jonathan Nestor tiene 24 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Jonathan Nestor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el cantón Ventanas. 

Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos, urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones las plantaciones.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque se podrá comprar los abonos, insumos y  semillas sin ningún tipo de problema.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes es la competencia, las plagas y el mal clima. El sueño es tener una casa con un negocio rentable.
En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte y leer libros.
texts.en:
Jonathan Nestor is 24 years old. He is in a common law relationship and has one son. He lives with his wife and his son in the Ventanas canton in the Ríos province. 

The Dulce Sentimiento communal bank is located in the Recinto Caimito II, in the Puerto Pechiche parish which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. This is a group of short cycle farmers who harvest corn, rice and pigeon peas

Jonathan Nestor is a farmer who grows corn, rice and pigeon peas. He buys and sells them in the Ventanas canton. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and supplies like urea, fertilizers and weed killers in order to keep his plots in good conditions. 

This loan will help a lot because he will be able to purchase fertilizer, supplies and seeds with any problems. His challenges he faces most frequently are competition, infestations and bad weather. His dream is to have a house with a profitable business. In his free time, he likes to play sports and read books.

loans.use: purchase seeds and supplies like urea, fertilizers and weed killers

loans.name: Richie

texts.en:
Richie works hard to support her family. Richie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Richie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, noodles, sugar, cream, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

Richie has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Richie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, noodles, sugar, cream, eggs and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 32 years old. She is a mother of two children and lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) is a construction worker who makes an income of $6 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Mom requests a loan of $800 to purchase a cow to breed and produce a calf to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to breed and produce a calf to sell.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 34 years old and married. She has two children.

Jinky works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Jinky has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from an Avon products dealership.

Jinky aspires to save enough money to have a grocery store at the public market.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en:
Moureen, 33, is a farmer in Kitale county in Kenya where she lives with her husband and three children, who are all schooling. 

She has been in farming for the past four years, producing eggs and tomatoes, which she sells at the local market in her area. Pests and diseases are her major challenges in farming.

She is requesting a 60,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. She will sell the products and use the money to boost her livelihood and pay for her children's schooling. She aspires to have 4,000 poultry birds and own a posho mill in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of three school-age children from Ubay, Bohol. 

She has owned and operated a sari-sari or variety store business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. 

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell in her store such as canned goods, candies, chips and snack foods, soap, beverages and toiletries. With this, she will be able to sell more products to her customers, thus increasing her sales and then her profit.

In the future, Jocelyn hopes to expand her business and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her store such as canned goods, candies, chips and snack foods, soap, beverages and toiletries.

loans.name: Teng

texts.en:
Teng is 52 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Prey Vevng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a policeman who makes an income of $7 daily. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Teng is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase cow to breed and produce calves to sell. By doing so, she will earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to breed and produce calves to sell.

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Jargalsaikhan, 48 years old, lives with his mother and sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is divorced from his wife and they have three children all of whom now live with their mother. His sister has a position as a sewer at a weaving factory. His mother, 67 years old, is retired from work. He himself has been working as a heavy truck driver at a private company. 

During winter in Mongolia, it becomes dark early. He and his sister come home from work very late and their mother stays all day alone. So they decided to strengthen the fences and the house they live in order to take all possible precautions that no possible attack or misfortune may fall on their mother. 

To strengthen the fences and house, he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase construction materials such as iron, planks and nails. As a result, the borrower and his sister can work enthusiastically without worrying about their mother’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 42 years old. He is married to Rose and they have three school-going children. He is a farmer in Nyahururu town where he plants cash crops such as maize and beans as well as keeping livestock which he also sells.

This is his second loan term and he plans to use the amount to buy sheep and goats which he will later sell at a profit. He will use the generated income to expand his cash crop business by buying fertilizer and seeds for planting.

David hopes to grow his farming and make more income and hence be able to provide for the needs of his family as well as pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy sheep and goats.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 29 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Riza is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Riza has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 24 years old and married. She has four children. She sells groceries and has been in business for four years. She is a hardworking and independent lady. Her business faces lots of competition from other grocery shops. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money and keep good records. 

Someday she hopes to expand her business and form a company in the future. She requires a loan of 42,727.50 KES to buy tomatoes, cabbage, onions, oranges, avocados and bananas.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage, onions,oranges, avocados and bananas.

loans.name: Maila

texts.en:
Maila is 22 years old and still single. Due to financial difficulties, she didn't pursue her studies in college. Despite this, she decided to engage in business to help her parents in generating income for their daily necessities and to save for her future. With a small capital, she started buying and selling fruits and vegetables in their community. She aims to improve and strengthen the business in order to increase her income. 

Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell. She hopes that this financial assistance will help her to make the business grow.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Samen

texts.en: Samen is 37 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband, who is beside her in the picture, purchases and resells cattle. He makes an income of $30 every day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns $4 each day. In order to improve her husband’s business, Samen requests a loan of $1000 to purchase more cattle to resell. This money will help her husband expand his business and earn more profit for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business overseas and help her children attend higher education.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish is a  married woman and a mother of two young children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than three years now. This is the source of their income. Irish is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and to buy materials for the repair of the boat like wood, nails, paint and others. With this, they will be able to maintain the good working condition of the fishing boat.

In the future, Irish has hopes of expanding their fishing business and improving their way of living. In addition to that, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her young children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and to buy materials for the repair of the boat like wood, nails, paint and others

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 35-year-old hard-working woman. She lives in Rawalpindi Pakistan with her husband, three sons, and three daughters. All of them are students. Her husband's income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Yasmeen is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. 

She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. Yasmeen is a member of a six-person group and has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. 

She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard used his previous loan amount to purchase a quarry site for mining stones. It was profitable since it enabled him to meet the high demand for building stones in the area.

This is his second loan and he plans to use the amount to buy quarry equipment since this will enable him increase his productivity. He also plans to employ more workers. He will use the generated income to open a small business for his wife.

He hopes to expand his quarry business by buying more quarry sites and to be able to make more income.

loans.use: To purchase quarry equipment

loans.name: Yakobo

texts.en:
Yakobo is a 37-year-old man with two children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop since 1999 and also has rental houses where he earns extra income. 

He began the business in order to support his growing family. He has challenges of lack of enough capital to realize his dreams and customers not paying on time. His dream is to have a housing estate. 

Yakobo intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, who is 26 years old and single, has a motorcycle with which he does a transport business in Nakuru town. He has been in the business for three years and it has been profitable.

This is his second loan term and he plans to use the loan amount and add to his savings so as to buy another motorcycle. He will use the generated income to buy another motorcycle.

He hopes to expand his transport business by buying a lorry.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Reyma

texts.en:
Reyma is 55 years old and married.  She has run a variety store for more than three years. 

Reyma is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy cooking oil, biscuits, sugar, milk, and soft drinks. In the future, Reyma would like to make her business a success and support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, biscuits, sugar, milk, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, groceries, and other items to sell in her store.

NWTF is relisting Evelyn's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, groceries, and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 36 years old, married, and has three children. She owns a salon and has been in business for three years. She also relies on her husband's salary, and was previously employed in a firm. 

Her salon is usually very busy. She is hard-working, honest, and diligent. 

She hopes to build a school for hair dressing, and to have a wholesale shop of cosmetics. 

She has requested a loan of 20,857.50 KES to buy hair chemicals, hair braids, and to purchase a business license.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals, hair braids, and to purchase a business license for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a fifty-year-old man with 7 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been cocoa farming since 1997 and also has a retail shop for extra income. Unpredictable price changes and pests affect his business profits, while his business plan is to expand his cocoa plantation. Stephen intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and rice to sell and also to pay workers who are harvesting his cocoa plantation.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and rice to sell, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a 32-year-old married man and a father of two young children from Ubay, Bohol. He is a carpenter and has been in the carpentry business for several years now. This is the source of his income. His wife works as healthcare personnel.

Joel is asking for a loan to buy materials for the renovation of his house, like cement, wood, nails, galvanized iron and others. With this, he will be able to fix and renovate the house thus providing a good shelter for his family, especially for the children. In the future, Joel hopes of expanding his business and to explore other ventures to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy materials for the renovation of his house, like cement, wood, nails, galvanized iron and others.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old, a business lady who owns a retail shop. She has been in business for the past ten years. She is very hard-working and describes her business as very busy. 

Faulu Kenya has helped her improve her living standards and learn how to save her money.

She hopes to expand her business and also own a wholesale shop. She needs a loan of 105,300 KES to buy basins, soaps, sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.use: to buy basins, sugar, soaps, wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
A very responsible mother and wife, Shirley, 48 years old, does everything to help her family and take care of the daily needs of her children. From the village of Dingading, she is engaged in her sari-sari store which is the common name of the general store in their village. 

Shirley wants to have more groceries to sell, therefore she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits, assorted bread and other ingredients to sell in her sari-sari store. She hopes that someday she can renovate her house for the convenience of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits, assorted bread and other ingredients to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 32-year-old artist. He has been in business for the last six years. He also earns an income by rearing chickens, which he later sells. 

He describes his business as very busy. He is very hard working. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has learnt how to save his money.

He hopes to be a graphic designer and to have acquired a degree in graphic design. 

He requires a loan of 20,857.50 KES to buy dye, ink, printing paper and models.

loans.use: to buy dye, ink, printing paper and models.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 22 years old and owns a motorbike. He has been in the transport business for three years. He also practices farming to earn a living. He is very hardworking. He has learned how to save his money since he joined Faulu Kenya. 

Someday he hopes to buy a piece of land and build rental houses. He requires a loan of 53,156 KES to buy seedlings, motorbike insurance and to repair his motorbike.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, motorbike insurance and to repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en: Marita is 52 years old and is married with seven children. To generate income, Marita is engaged in buying and selling vegetables and fruits in their village. She has been in her business for four years. Marita is happy because aside from her business, she has also managed their small sari-sari store. Right now, Marita is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 to buy eggplant, string beans and bananas to sell. She hopes to earn a higher income this time for the purpose of financial security for her business and family.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, string beans and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is an age fifty-one farmer in Kitale county in Kenya where she lives with her husband and four children who are all schooling. She has been farming for the past six years, producing vegetables and poultry products that she sells at the local market in her area.

She is requesting a 60,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. She would sell the products and use the money to boost her livelihood, and she would use some of the money to pay school fees for her children. She aspires to have two thousand poultry birds and to be the leading supplier of eggs in her area in the next five years.

Pests and diseases are her major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz  used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business. He is a married businessman living Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is in the transportation business and also owns a retail shop. Price fluctuations, customers not paying on time, and high taxes are the main challenges he is facing. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent home. His business goal is to own at least five motorcycles since his business is very lucrative. 

Aziz intends to use the loan to buy a new motorcycle for his business.

loans.use: To buy a second motorcycle for his transportation business

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is 49 and he is married with three children. He works as a repairer and supports his family with the income earned by this labor. He has built his own house and wants to finish it. Due to a money shortage, he has applied for a loan to cover the cost of construction materials.
 
In addition to this work he is planning to open a grocery store. He will increase his income and after that will buy a car. Today his main challenge is that he can’t receive repair orders outside his district.

loans.use: To cover the cost of construction materials.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is 26 years old, married, and she has one child. She has been in business for the past five years. She also sells clothes to earn a living. She describes her business as being very busy. 

Someday she hopes to expand her business and own a van. She needs a loan of 42,727 KES to buy soda, maize flour, wheat flour and basins.

loans.use: to buy soda, maize flour, wheat flour and basins.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 28 years old, married, and she has two children. She owns a salon and has been in business for two years. Her salon is very busy and she has very loyal customers. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her money for the future. 

She hopes to expand her business and buy more cosmetics. She requires a loan of 42,727 KES to buy hair chemicals, hair weaves and hair braids.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals, hair weaves and hair braids.

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Chinda is 33 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than seven years, earning approximately $5 each day. Her husband, who is joining her in the picture, is a sewing machine repairer who makes an income of about $7 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Chinda requests a loan of $1,000 to purchase rice to store in a warehouse and resell when the price is higher. By doing so, she would generate more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase rice to store in the warehouse and resell when the price is higher.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 20 years old and owns a motorbike. He has been in business for two years. He also practices farming where he grows tomatoes for sale. He is very hard-working and responsible. His business is very busy. Faulu Kenya has helped him save his money for the future.

He hopes to be an established businessman and to buy another motorbike. He requires a loan of 74,013 KES to buy spare parts for his motorbike and to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorbike and to buy a cow

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 31 years old, married and has two school-aged children. Due to financial difficulty, she engages in buying and selling charcoal to help her husband in generating income. With the support of her husband, she believes that they will improve their standard of living and give their children a better life. 

Christina planned to acquire more charcoal to sell in the local community but she has not enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of P9,000 to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell in their community. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business as she continues to work hard and strive.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
This is Melinda, 52, a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Elmer, a pastor, and is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household as they go hand-in-hand in generating income for their family. Melinda has a big heart for the kids.

Melinda co-owns a school that offers education from preschool up until high school. The students who enroll in the school are mostly from the community and from the nearby communities. She earns from the co-owners' sharing of capital gains. Her monthly income is 80,000 PHP (Philippines pesos).

To help her continue operation of the business, she is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to pay the salaries of the employees and teachers and to pay for the maintenance of the school. The loan will also be used in paying for the bills, like electric, water, permits and other bills. She expects that the school will attract more students.

Melinda hopes that there will be more children who will have an education, and she dreams of having her own house and lot. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay the salaries of the employees and teachers and to pay for the maintenance of the school.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a businessman who owns a retail shop. He is married and has three children who are all in school. He has been in business for the past 14 years. He owns rental houses from which he gets an income from and is also in the business of making detergents. He used to sell groceries. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has become enlightened on how to carry out his businesses through seminars. 

Someday he hopes to educate his children to the university level and to also expand his business. He requires a loan of 37,513 KES (Kenyan shillings) to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel is 34 years old and lives with her mother and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house, in the outer ger (Mongolian housing tents) housing districts of the city. Odgerel’s mother is retired and stays at home, while Odgerel's daughter attends secondary school. She built her house with her business income, especially with the help from the Kiva loan.

Odgerel supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. In 2006, when she first began her business, she sold only leather belts and traditional Mongolian fabric belts. In the beginning stages of her business, she rented a stall at the present market from another person who had a rental contract with the market. This was an unstable business situation for her because the middleman could dismiss her at any time. At the time, her stall had 1 million MNT (Mongolian tugriks) in working capital. Usually, it is very difficult to obtain a rental contract with Narantuul because the stalls are in such high demand. 

At this time of year, it is the one of high shopping seasons, since it's the beginning of the Tsagaan Sar holiday. Odgerel wants to use this loan to help support her inventory in this very busy shopping season of the year. Odgerel's business goal is to one day operate her own clothing shop. Odgerel also said, "It's my personal goal to support my mother and daughter so they can live happily."

loans.use: to purchase more clothing products to sell and purchase a TV and PC for her home.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is a 44-year-old married woman. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business in her place in Ubay, Bohol. She sells various goods and products to the people in her place and she has been in the business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Eleuteria is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, sodas and beverages, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater for more buyers in her store thus augmenting her sales and profit.

In the future, Eleuteria hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, sodas and beverages, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Byambadorj

texts.en:
Mr. Byambadorj, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. His wife stays at home and looks after their two children who are five and one years old.  

Since 2009, he has been working as an inspector in the police department and in 2012 he began to instruct legislation at the university. His wife has found a way of generating more income by opening a grocery store on their land. He himself supported this idea. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to acquire the special license which is essential for operating a grocery store and some necessary goods such as breads, cookies and sweets. As a result, the family can generate more income in addition his salary thus enabling them to save more money to be used for their children’s future needs.

loans.use: to acquire the special license for a grocery store.

loans.name: Ambreen's Group

texts.en:
Ambreen is a 23-year-old hard-working woman. She lives in Pakistan with her husband, and son. Her husband's income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Ambreen is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. 

She is an efficient tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. Ambreen is a member of an eight-person group and has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 50 years old and sells charcoal. She has four children and has been in business for five years. She also runs a cafeteria and has employed three employees who help her run the cafeteria. She also has rental houses, which she rents out to customers. She used to previously sell cereals. 

She hopes to expand her business and have her own business premises. She requires a loan of 20,857 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy charcoal, cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and potatoes.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 52 years old and married with three children. Victoria works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery products to sell in her store. Victoria has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es:
Ketty, de 36 años, es una mujer joven, amable y carismática, es soltera y madre de dos hijos de 9 años y 12 años de edad respectivamente, vive en la casa de sus padres a lado de sus pequeños hijos, ella como toda madre quiere lo mejor para sus hijos es por eso que diariamente se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante.
El trabajo principal de Ketty consiste en la venta de plátanos. Tiene un puesto ubicado en uno de los mercados principales de la ciudad hasta donde llega diariamente luego de obtener en el puerto fluvial la cantidad de racimos necesarios para la venta. Ocasionalmente, dependiendo de la temporada ofrece a la venta yuca, limones, cocona y otros alimentos de origen animal como pescado seco y carnes de animales silvestres como venado, tortugas, majas y gallinas de chacra. Realiza ésta actividad hace 3 años, lo hace con mayor énfasis cuando en la ciudad se celebra alguna festividad o acontecimiento importante; afortunadamente su trabajo le genera buenos ingresos económicos que le dan tranquilidad emocional. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener contacto con las personas, le da vitalidad y mucha energía estar en constante actividad física y sobre todo se siente feliz porque puede generar sus propios ingresos económicos para continuar solventado sus gastos. Este es el crédito numero 2 con MFP, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual y espera continuar trabajando con su banco comunal por el compañerismo y la solidaridad que muestran entre ellos cada uno de sus integrantes.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de plátano para continuar trabajando en su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Ketty, 36, is the friendly, charismatic single mother of two children, ages 9 and 12, who live with her in her parents' home. As any mother, she wants the best for her children and works hard daily to get ahead. After picking up the required number of stalks she needs to sell at the river port each day, Kelly sells the plantains at her stall located in one of the main city markets. Depending on the season, she sometimes sells yuca, lemons, cocona, dried seafood and meats such as tortoise, crab, and free-range chicken.

She has been in business for three years and works longer hours when the city celebrates holidays or important events. Fortunately, she earns a good income, which gives her financial peace of mind. She loves that her works lets her interact with people; that the physical activity makes her feel energetic; and that, above all, it provides income to pay her expenses.

This is her second loan cycle with MFP, and she thanks the lenders for providing the necessary funding to firm up her plans. She promises to make her payments on time and hopes to continue working with her communal bank, whose members are unified and care about each other. She will use the loan of 1000 soles to buy wholesale plantains to sell at her stall.

loans.use: to buy wholesale plantains to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Juliter

texts.en:
Juliter is a hardworking person and a responsible mother. She has a fruit and vegetable stand which has provided her not only with income but also enough experience. Her business is located in a very good strategic spot for any business. Juliter works from Monday to Sunday and she has many dedicated customers who prefer her because she is friendly and her produce prices are fair.

Thanks to the previous loan she was able to restock her stall hence offering a variety of fruits and vegetables to her customers. Juliter is asking Yehu for another loan to buy more vegetables, such as cabbages, eggplant, lettuce, potatoes, kale, tomatoes, bananas, watermelons, and others that will allow her to have a more stable business that makes good profits.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, such as cabbages, eggplant, lettuce, potatoes, kale, tomatoes, bananas and watermelons.

loans.name: Ma. Anne

texts.en:
Ma. Anne is a 35-year-old married woman, a mother of a two-year-old son, and is from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fish-vending business for several years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Ma. Anne is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. With this, she will be able to sell more thus augmenting her sales and earnings.

In the future, Ma. Anne hopes to make her business a success and save money for the future schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lomela

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lomela works hard to support her family.

She has a business raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales.  Lomela is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

Lomela has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Marilyn aimed to improve her small business, to help her husband satisfy their basic necessities and finance the education of her children. She is 34 years old and has four school-age children. 

Because of the high cost of commodities and school fees, Marilyn planned to acquire more fruits and vegetables to sell in the market. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional PHP 25,000 to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell. 

Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will improve the business and hopes that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: James Joshua

texts.en:
James Joshua is a married married man and a father of three children from Ubay, Bohol. He has owned and run a motorcycle transport business for more than three years now. This is the source of his income.

James Joshua is asking for a loan to buy fuel and spare parts, like nuts and bolts for the motorcycle. With this, he will be able to enhance his daily earning thus he will be able to provide the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fuel and spare parts for the motorcycle, like nuts and bolts

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is a 30-year-old farmer in Kitale county in Kenya where he lives with his wife and four children who are all schooling. He has been in farming for the past four years producing milk, maize and beans which he sells at the local market in his area.

Enock is requesting a 52,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow from which he will get more milk production and earn extra income. That will help boost his livelihood and be able to use some of the money to educate his children. He hopes to have four dairy cows and be the leading supplier of milk in his area in the next five years.

Pests and diseases are his major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran is 51 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and other agricultural crops for more than ten years, earning approximately $7 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. One of her children is a garment worker. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Saran is requesting a loan of $1,300 to purchase fertilizer to use for radish cultivation. This purchase will help her radishes grow well and provide high yield. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and help her youngest child earn a higher education. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to use for radish cultivation.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is 26 years old, married and has two children. She sells potatoes in the market and has been in business for the past seven years. She also practices farming. She is very hardworking as she has to provide for her family. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, her profits have increased tremendously. She hopes to buy a lorry for transporting potatoes. She needs a loan of 13,453 KES to buy a gas cooker.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
To make a living, Lucena has operated her general store for more than three years. She earns PHP 300 each day through the business, which is being rolled into revolving capital to maintain the business. She is 54 years old and is married with six children. 

To expand her retailing, she is taking out this loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase stock such as canned goods, groceries, noodles, shampoo, and spices to sell. Lucena hopes to further grow her general store and to increase her income, which will secure her family's future and the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as canned goods, groceries, noodles, shampoo, and spices to sell.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 32 years old, married and has one child. She runs a pharmacy and has been in business for the past five years. She also earns an income through dairy farming. She was previously employed in a chemist. She is very hard-working and committed to her work. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has become financially stable. 

She hopes to open another pharmacy. She wants a loan of 105,300 KES to buy four cartons of cough syrup, antibiotics and creams.

loans.use: to buy four cartons of cough syrup, antibiotics and creams.

loans.name: Bshair Group

texts.en:
The Bashair group consists five female ladies from Hodidah, Yemen. Each member has her own type of business. They have requested a group loan of 100,000 YER, and they will hold each other accountable for a loan repayment. 

Afraq is a 31-year-old mother of 6 children, most of them are in school. The income of her previous type of job was not enough to cover her children's school fees and the other important household expense requirements and made her unable to dedicate enough time for her kids. Now she has shifted to a more profitable business by selling perfumes and incense. So, she is asking for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to start up her business. She will use this loan to buy more perfumes and incense for resale. Her dream is to one day diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes and incense for resale.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a 22-year-old married gentle man. He operates a motorbike business and has been in business for the past four years. He also practices farming. He is very hard working and Faulu Kenya has helped him learn how to budget the profits he gets from his business. 

He hopes to buy three motorbikes. He requests a loan of 53,156 KES to buy a cow, purchase insurance cover and repair his motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a cow, purchase insurance cover and repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Álvaro es una persona humilde, él vive en un pueblo llamado Guambalo situado en la ciudad de Ambato, Álvaro es soltero vive junto a sus padres y trabaja para darles todo lo que ellos necesiten. Álvaro se define como una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y con infinito amor hacia su familia y sus semejantes. 
Álvaro solicita el presente crédito a FODEMI para invertir en la compra de semilla de cebolla de buena calidad para mejorar su producción y en el mejoramiento y tratamiento del terreno con la compra de abonos, para cuidarlo y darle mantenimiento para la próxima siembra. 
El sueño que Álvaro  tiene es llegar a comprarse un vehículo para el mismo ir a los mercados a comercializar su producto, y con estos ingresos estudiar la universidad y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres.
texts.en:
Álvaro is a modest man who lives in the Guambalo area of the city of Ambato. He is single, lives with his parents, and works to give them everything they need. He is hardworking, responsible, and acts lovingly toward his family and friends. 

Álvaro is applying to FODEMI for a loan to buy quality onion seed for better production and to buy manure to improve and treat his land for the next planting. He dreams of buying a vehicle to transport and sell his products at the markets. He would use his earnings to go to college and improve his parents' lives.

loans.use: to buy quality onion seed for better production and to improve and treat his land.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is from the village of Kianeti. She is married and lives with her family: her husband and 20-year-old son. The family owns a donkey and a milk cow. Marine milks it twice a day and produces cheese, which is sold at the local open market. In addition, her husband produces horseshoes and locally sells them. 

Several times, Marine requested a loan from local financial institutions for her agricultural business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of her low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Her current loan request was approved because of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to loans since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Marine will purchase materials for horseshoes. Her husband will produce them and sell at a good price. Another part of the credit will be used for setting up a grain mill. Her mill will serve the local farmers and crush the grains. As a result of the Kiva loan, the family will get additional income and will use it for improving the living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for horseshoes and to set up a grain mill.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 41 years old and married. He has been blessed with two children. He is a soda and water distributor and has been in business for the past ten years. He also earns an income from farming. He is very hardworking and ambitious. Through the help of Faulu Kenya, he has expanded his business. 
He hopes to own rental houses. He requests a loan of 32,298.75 KES to increase his stock of soda and distilled water.

loans.use: to increase his stock of soda and distilled water.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is married and works hard to provide for her family.
